perturbation.original_text: IMedicor will charge a subscription fee to participating USA MCO providers. The suggested monthly subscription would be $19.95 per month per subscriber. USA MCO would receive one third of the monthly subscription price, per month, per subscriber (approximately $6.65). All revenue sharing opportunities will be calculated for all parties after any credit card or other third party processing fees are deducted from the gross sale.
perturbation.changed_text: IMedicor will charge a subscription fee to participating USA MCO providers. The suggested monthly fee would be $19.95 per month per subscriber. USA MCO would receive 33.3% of the monthly subscription price, per month, per user (approximately $6.65). All revenue sharing opportunities will be calculated for all parties before any credit card or other third party processing fees are deducted from the gross income.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'subscription' to 'fee', 'subscriber' to 'user', 'one third' to '33.3%', 'price' to 'amount' and 'sale' to 'income' creates confusion about the exact calculation and nature of the payment. The original text clearly defines the monthly subscription calculation based on per 'subscriber' but the modified version uses 'user' making it inconsistent. The use of 33.3% instead of one third will also make the text ambiguous and contradictory.

perturbation.original_text: In such an instance, all compensation will continue for a extended period of five years from the date of termination for all subscriptions tagged as USA MCO.
perturbation.changed_text: In such an instance, all remuneration will continue for an extended period of five years from the date of termination for all accounts tagged as USA MCO.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'compensation' with 'remuneration' and 'subscriptions' with 'accounts' introduces ambiguity about exactly what payments and customers are covered in the event of termination. Now it's not clear whether it also includes those which are not subscriptions but fall under some other category of accounts.

perturbation.original_text: Recipient hereby agrees that it shall disclose Confidential Information of Discloser only to those of its officer(s), manager(s), and/or employee(s) who need to know such information and certifies that such officer(s), manager(s), and/or employee(s) have previously agreed, either as a condition of employment or in order to obtain the Confidential Information, to be bound by terms and conditions substantially similar to those of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Recipient hereby agrees that it shall disclose Proprietary Data of Discloser only to those of its directors, supervisors, and/or staff who need to know such information and represents that such directors, supervisors, and/or staff have previously agreed, either as a requirement of service or in order to obtain the Proprietary Data, to be bound by terms and conditions consistent with those of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Confidential Information' to 'Proprietary Data', 'officer(s)' to 'directors', 'manager(s)' to 'supervisors', 'employee(s)' to 'staff', 'condition of employment' to 'requirement of service', and 'substantially similar' to 'consistent with' creates confusion about the exact scope of confidentiality, personnel covered, and nature of agreement required. It is unclear if 'Proprietary Data' has the same standards as 'Confidential Information'. Different terms and definitions creates a legal contradiction.
